instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_I: What is PM_SLP_S4_I? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L. When you see PM_SLP_S4_I, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged in area lcd connector, no water damage anywhere else. Customer said laptop worked until image disappear. Connector is rusted out and few pads completely burnt out. That is straight forward. Main issue is that it doesn't turn on from power button, green light present.
I found identical topic on advanced rework with no solution and reference to 3 Luises videos. Non of them really applicable in my case. There is no water damage nowhere near SMC.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_REG</SIGNAL> missing
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
pin 4 = 0v
pin2 = 0v
pin12 =3v
pin21=3v
pin23= 12v
pin22=3v
pin13=2v
pin29=5v

The other thing is that it chargers if I attache the battery (yellow light). Also it auto turn on if I plug adapter with battery attached, no chime.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_I</SIGNAL> come out of <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>, I couldnt find out what powers <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>, to find out whether it is power to <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> or <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> is the issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hi, check <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> which comes from the SMC. Present or not?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Are you using a REAL ORIGINAL 85W charger? I guess not cause it needs the battery to turn on if you don't.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 9909"]Are you using a REAL ORIGINAL 85W charger? I guess not cause it needs the battery to turn on if you don't.[/QUOTE]

I used 65w as I didnt have original 85W, I figured if Voltage is the same it should be okay for diagnostic purpose. Obviously I was wrong.

With non original 85 charger I get fan spinning as soon as I plug it in and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_I</SIGNAL> 3.3v. Thank you Duke.

Last quick question, shouldn't it chime after I connect power and fan spins? I dont get the sound with board speaker connected (ram is connected, hddd not), and it will take me some time to fix lcd connector (need jumpers) and order new lcd flex before I can test it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
